strings.Value: "Not all of us were born for adventure, Mim. You'd better go back home."
"Everyone makes mistakes. But some give up, while others stand up and go on! I'm going to climb this mountain, no matter what it takes. What about you?"
"What are you doing here?"
"What's the matter here?"
[Use magic] "I have just the spell for you..."
"Let me see."
"I can't help you right now."
[Try fixing the dislocated joint] "You didn't break your ankle, you twisted it. Hold on for a second, all right?"
"There's no fracture â€“ it's just dislocated. But I'm not sure I can fix it myself..."
"About your ankle..."
"I'm sorry, I was trying to set it back in its socket. But it seems too badly twisted."
"Ouch. That must have hurt."
"Watch your tongue if you want to keep it."
"I have to go."
"You decided to go on, even after you saw giant spiders?"
"It's... it's you!"

{n}{d|Mim}Mim's{/d} clothes are dirty, and her hair is matted.{/n} "Good gods! I feared I would... I would have to stay... here forever..." {n}Tears are running down her dirty cheeks, leaving light trails on her skin.{/n}

"I... I wanted to climb {g|Talon Peak}Talon Peak{/g}. It was... a sudden decision. I just thought, why put it off? Why ask for someone else to help, like I always do? Why can't I just get my wish by myself? After all, I left father so I could achieve everything on my own. So, I decided to climb the mountain alone. Skies above, my pride nearly sent me to my grave!"

{n}A smile appears on Mim's pale face.{/n} "After all, what good would an ascent be if there weren't any obstacles along the way? I'm not giving up! Let's go! To the top! You're coming with me, right?"
{n}Mim lowers her head and sighs heavily.{/n} "You're... you're right. I should know that my place is in the workshop with my tools. Just show me the way, and I'll be off."

"I think I broke my ankle... I was fighting some spiders, and stepped on a stone, and it slipped, and I tripped and fell, and hit my ankle... I managed to drive away the beasts, but it's still messed up. It hurts too much to walk on. I crawled for several hours, but I couldn't..."
{n}Mim relaxes her shoulders in relief.{/n} "Whew... That's much better. Thank you so much!"
{n}Mim's ankle is swollen and red. It looks more like a dislocation than a fracture. You palpate the area to find the bone intact.{/n}
"Think of something, please..."
{n}Mim's ankle looks swollen and red. You'll need help of an expert medic...{/n}
"Wait, what... OUCH!" {n}The joint clicks back into place.{/n} "Oh... well... It feels better... Much better! Thank you very much! Here, I'll try to get up..."
"Wait, what... OUCH! Devil's mercy, that hurts! What the hell do you think you're doing?"
{n}Mim looks away.{/n} "I see. Well, thanks for trying to help."
{n}Mim inhales, then breathes out slowly.{/n} "Just... don't. All right?"
"So, the bones are intact... So that's good. I think."
{n}Mim flinches and lowers her head.{/n} "I'm sorry, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}. The pain is clouding my judgment."
{n}Mim looks at you with hope.{/n}
"Yes... I can walk now. But where should I go?"

"Don't get me wrong, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}. I... I suddenly realized what my third wish would be. What I need to do, to find my inspiration. I must climb {g|Talon Peak}Talon Peak{/g}! To see the world from that height, to rise above myself... that's what my soul has been craving! But I don't know if I can make it."
"For heaven's sake, come back soon!"
{n}Mim's face turns red.{/n} "I'm a mage! Before I tripped, I was handling them just fine! They were still afraid to attack, the spineless creeps..."
